page.title: 04HOUSING IN WESTON
page.content: Weston is an{expensive area.}House prices start from thirty thousand pounds for a{terraced cottage}in need of restoration. Most of the houses are {privately owned,}there is a small area of{council housing}which is of cul-de- sac design and rather isolated. There are{bungalows}and an{old peoples {wardened housing area.}Around the church and the green are the oldest houses. At present there is a{derelict {cottage}in Fore St. damaged by fire. {Weston Manor}in the Park and{Lannock {Manor}are owned by the Pryor family. Many of the smaller outlying{cottages were originally for{farm workers}in this agricultural area. The relatives of several schoolchildren have built property here which include two houses off Maiden Street and a cottage in Hatch Lane which is now being extended.
